glsa.title: GnuTLS: RSA Signature Forgery
glsa.synopsis: GnuTLS fails to handle excess data which could allow an attacker to forge a PKCS #1 v1.5 signature.

background.p: GnuTLS is an implementation of SSL 3.0 and TLS 1.0.

description.p: verify.c fails to properly handle excess data in digestAlgorithm.parameters field while generating a hash when using an RSA key with exponent 3. RSA keys that use exponent 3 are commonplace.

impact.p: Remote attackers could forge PKCS #1 v1.5 signatures that are signed with an RSA key, preventing GnuTLS from correctly verifying X.509 and other certificates that use PKCS.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
